code:
def is_prime?(num)
  return false if num <= 1
  
  (2..Math.sqrt(num)).each do |i|
    return false if num % i == 0
  end
  
  true
end

final_answer(answer: "Ruby function to check if a number is prime")
raw_response:
Thought: To check if a number is prime, we need to see if it has any divisors other than 1 and itself. We can do this by iterating from 2 up to the square root of the number, checking if it's divisible by any of those numbers. If not, then it must be prime.

```ruby
def is_prime?(num)
  return false if num <= 1
  
  (2..Math.sqrt(num)).each do |i|
    return false if num % i == 0
  end
  
  true
end

final_answer(answer: "Ruby function to check if a number is prime")
```
